statusLeds.information: Monitors wheater or not each application is running or not. Check configuration or logfiles of you encounter any issues

startCasting.title: Start / Stop castings
startCasting.information: This will start all the applications you have enabled in the correct order.

autostart.title: Enable Autostart
autostart.information: UAVcast will start automatically when raspberry boots up.

flightcontroller.title: Flight Controller
flightcontroller.subTitle: Flight Controller configuration
flightcontroller.fcTypeDescription: Choose a flight controller. All ardupilot versions and Px4 is supported.

tips.1: Its very important that both RPI and FC shares the same electrical ground if you have connected your FC to RPI GPIO, serial communication depends on that.
tips.2: If you experience issues using USB cable, make sure you have removed all other USB devices from RPI. Some USB devices could cause conflicts.

navio.launchOptionsDescription: Mapping between switches and serial ports.

groundControlStation.title: Ground Control Station
groundControlStation.subTitle: Add Ground Control Station IP address and port.
groundControlStation.subTitle1: NOTE! Adding Ground Control IP addresses only applies if UDP is selected for Telemetry or video

modem.title: Modem
modem.subTitle: Modem configuration
modem.enableText:
Enable cellular Modem?
Modem Manager is used to establish a carrier connection. You can find all supported devices
modem.modelDescription:
Choose between Stick or HiLink
Example: E3276H (Ending character)
HiLink modems uses embedded software to connect LTE / 4G network
modem.hilinkInterfaceDescription:
Set the HiLink modem interface name. This is normally eth1 for RPI 2/3 and eth0 for Pi0w.
LED will turn green if the interface has proper internet access.
modem.managerDescription: Select whether or not you want to use Network Manager or Modem Manager to manage the cell connection. Modems behaves diffrently, so test both options if you have issues. Its recommended to restart RPI if you change this option.
modem.stickInterfaceDescription:
Set the Stick modem interface name. This is normally either wwan0 or ppp0. You can see the interface name by pressing the network button below.
LED will turn green if the interface has proper internet access.
modem.apnDescription: An Access Point Name is the name of a gateway between a GSM, GPRS, 3G or 4G mobile network and another computer network, frequently the public Internet
modem.internalAddressDescription:
USB modem interal Address. USB modems usually get
cdc-wdm0. You can specify another address if needed.
modem.usernameDescription: Most carriers dont require any username or password, but some might.
modem.passwordDescription: Most carriers dont require any username or password, but some might.
modem.pinDescription: You sim pin code, unless you have disabled Pin Authorization

tips.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips.1: HiLink modems will act the same way as an Ethernet cable. RPI will be online as soon as you insert the modem
tips.2: You can find all supported modems here https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/ModemManager/SupportedDevices/

dynamicDns.title: DNS
dynamicDns.subTitle: Dynamic DNS configuration
dynamicDns.aliasDescription: Dns Alias is your newly created address
dynamicDns.dnsSystemDescription: DNS System is created by your host

tips.title: Troubleshooting Tips
tips.1: DDNS or DynamicDNS is a way to link a web url to a IP address. Its convenient if you want to connect remote partner with a dynamic IP.
tips.2: You can use free vendors such as https://www.noip.com, https://www.duckdns.org/

camera.title: Camera
camera.subTitle: Camera configuration
camera.tcpHostDescription: Add TCP Host IP address. This should be the Raspberry Pi ipadress.
camera.cameraFlipDescription: Select the image orientation. Horizontal or vertical flip.

tips.title: Tips
tips.1:
Select custom pipeline and add this code to generate a test video stream. Nice to test without a camera connected. Change the IP and Port to match your settings
gst-launch-1.0 videotestsrc ! x264enc ! video/x-h264, stream-format=byte-stream ! rtph264pay ! udpsink host=192.168.1.100 port=5600
tips.2: Mission planner and QGroundControl will automatically detect video stream on port 5600
tips.3:
To receive UDP video feed on a Windows computer, install gstreamer and use this pipeline. Remember to change the port to match your setting.
gst-launch-1.0 -v udpsrc port=5600 caps='application/x-rtp, media=(string)video, clock-rate=(int)90000, encoding-name=(string)H264' ! rtpjitterbuffer ! rtph264depay ! avdec_h264 ! videoconvert ! autovideosink sync=false
tips.4:
To receive TCP (Only for PiCam) video on Windows computer, install gstreamer and use this pipeline. Remember to change the port and host to match your setting.
gst-launch-1.0 -v tcpclientsrc host='Pi-IP' port=5600 ! gdpdepay ! rtph264depay ! avdec_h264 ! videoconvert ! autovideosink sync=false

vpn.title: VPN
vpn.subTitle: Virtual Private Network
vpn.configurationDescription:
Your openvpn configuration file.
See VPN help section on how to generate / download this file

tips.title: Tips
tips.1: Its highly recommended to use ZeroTier VPN. Very easy to configure and its using the NAT travesal technic. ZeroTier will try to esablish a direct connection without using 3rd party server. This will reduce the latency.
tips.2: Google provides an easy way to launch a openvpn server. Read more here https://openvpn.net/index.php/access-server/on-google-cloud.html
